title: Activity-Based Learning and Reflection Process to Address Learning Failures in Information Systems Development (ISD)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic information system development concepts
context.additional_context: Hands-on training for current professionals. Conducts smartphone-based learning in constrained technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze failure factors at each ISD project stage and propose improvement measures
Learners design collaborative problem-solving processes for real-world tasks using activity-based learning techniques

Learners write a reflective journal weekly during the ISD (Instructional Systems Design) process, systematically analyze three learning experiences (e.g., design phase, assessment methods, content development) within 500 characters, establish at least two specific improvement plans (e.g., next-week implementation strategies, resource utilization plans) based on the analysis, submit them as a PDF document, and achieve an average of 4 points or higher on a 5-point rubric (clarity, feasibility, effectiveness) evaluated by the instructor.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
